item.title: Mexico City metro overpass collapse kills 23
item.description: Two train carriages plunged to the ground when an elevated metro line collapsed.

item.title: India passes 20 million cases amid oxygen shortage
item.description: Officials say infections are slowing, but erratic testing and under-reporting cast doubt on their claims.

item.title: IPL suspended after rise in Covid-19 cases among players
item.description: The Indian Premier League is suspended after an increase in coronavirus cases among players.

item.title: Bill and Melinda Gates divorce after 27 years of marriage
item.description: The billionaire couple, who jointly run a charity organisation, say they can no longer "grow together".

item.title: The Americans hesitant about the Covid vaccine
item.description: For the US to achieve herd immunity, it needs to convince two big groups to get the jab.

item.title: Shark attack survivor wins right to keep tooth left in surfboard
item.description: Surfer Chris Bowes lost his leg but authorities return a tooth the shark left wedged in his board.

item.title: Kangana Ranaut: Twitter suspends Bollywood actress account
item.description: Kangana Ranaut's account was suspended over a tweet where she allegedly incited violence.

item.title: Senior Swiss diplomat in Iran 'dies in fall from high-rise building'
item.description: Iranian media report that the 51-year-old woman fell from the high-rise building where she lived.

item.title: Belgian farmer accidentally moves French border
item.description: The farmer moved a two-century-old border stone into French territory as it was blocking his tractor.

item.title: Britney Spears attacks 'hypocritical' documentaries in Instagram post
item.description: The singer attacks recent films for focusing on "negative and traumatising" moments in her life.

item.title: Iraq bans terror prank TV shows
item.description: The two shows sparked outrage after using fake suicide vests and staging kidnappings.

item.title: Joe Biden raises Trump refugee cap after backlash
item.description: The president says the record-low refugee limit he originally stuck by did not 'reflect America's values'.

item.title: Teens, tech and mental health: Oxford study finds no link
item.description: The Oxford study used data from more than 430,000 young people, gathered over 28 years.

item.title: Colombia tax protests: At least 17 dead, ombudsman says
item.description: The reforms, which would have increased taxes on low earners, have now been shelved.

item.title: Covid: Japan town builds giant squid statue with relief money
item.description: Noto, which is known for its flying squid, hopes the giant statue will draw back tourists.

item.title: UK's Royal Marines test out jet suit
item.description: The Royal Marines are testing out a jet suit to assist in Maritime Boarding Operations.

item.title: Canadian sign war captivates the internet
item.description: For the past week, businesses in a Canadian town have been embroiled in a war of words via signs.

item.title: Microchip shortage: Inside a factory racing to meet demand
item.description: Katie Silver tours a microchip factory in Singapore racing to meet demand amid a global shortage.

item.title: How rising sea levels are threatening my home
item.description: Hereiti, 17, lives on Rarotonga, the largest of the Cook Islands in the South Pacific Ocean.

item.title: 'We spent 40 days in a cave without sunlight or watches'
item.description: The Deep Time study aims to see how humans can adapt to isolation and losing their sense of time.

item.title: Asian hate crime in UK increases during pandemic
item.description: Asians in the UK share the abuse they've faced - from racial slurs to being spat at and punched.

item.title: Italy's plan for a new floor at the Colosseum
item.description: Work on a wooden, retractable floor at the Roman landmark is expected to be finished by 2023.

item.title: Dove Cameron: Why the former Disney star is one to watch in 2021
item.description: With two TV shows, a movie and a pop career in the making, the former Disney star is one to watch.

item.title: Food giants respond to worries over packaging
item.description: The phasing out of single-use plastics gathers pace with big companies adopting alternatives.

item.title: Covid in Varanasi: Anger rises as coronavirus rages in Modi's constituency
item.description: Many in Varanasi are asking where their MP - India's prime minister - is in their hour of need.

item.title: Samia Suluhu Hassan - Tanzania's new president challenges Covid denial
item.description: Samia Suluhu Hassan's predecessor, who died in office in March, said coronavirus had been defeated.

item.title: Five Eyes: Is the alliance in trouble over China?
item.description: The Five Eyes intelligence alliance has expanded into politics but faces a split in dealing with Beijing.

item.title: The rise of India's 'Covid quack'
item.description: An anti-vaccine doctor falsely claims to be able to cure coronavirus, diabetes and Aids through diet alone

item.title: Battle of wits: Antiguans revel in ancient board game
item.description: Warri is a board game popular in Antigua which traces its origins back to Africa.

item.title: Jose Mourinho named Roma boss from start of next season
item.description: Jose Mourinho has been appointed Roma manager from the start of the 2021-22 season.

item.title: PSG face anxious wait over Mbappe fitness for Man City semi-final
item.description: Paris St-Germain face an anxious wait to see if Kylian Mbappe will be fit to face Manchester City in Tuesday's Champions League semi-final second leg.

item.title: Westbrook, Curry and Anthony shine in NBA
item.description: Russell Westbrook, Stephen Curry and Carmelo Anthony star, but Monday night belongs to the New York Knicks who record their 12th win in 13 games.

item.title: Murder-accused PC kicked and Tasered ex-Villa striker Atkinson
item.description: Dalian Atkinson was Tasered for six times longer than standard by PC Benjamin Monk, a court is told.

item.title: 'Absolutely the maximum for us' - Verstappen defends Portugal performance
item.description: Max Verstappen says second place at the Portuguese Grand Prix was the most he and Red Bull could have achieved.

item.title: Who takes his side to 'another level' - and made Garth Crooks' team of the week?
item.description: Who takes his side to another level? Who has been a credit to the Premier League? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

item.title: On? Off? The Joshua-Fury saga continues
item.description: Bob Arum says it is "dead in the water" but Eddie Hearn says "this fight is on". The Anthony Joshua v Tyson Fury saga continues, plus more boxing news and reaction.

item.title: The young woman trying to adopt her friend
item.description: Arina hopes to formally adopt her friend Nina, whom she looked after during the Covid pandemic.

item.title: They are killing our forest, Brazilian tribe warns
item.description: The Awa, who have been called "the most threatened tribe on earth", face fresh challenges in Brazil.

item.title: Zac Easter: He left his brain behind to save others from his fate
item.description: Zac Easter killed himself at the age of 24, having suffered for years from a debilitating disease caused by the sport he loved.

item.title: How the Bay of Pigs invasion began - and failed - 60 years on
item.description: The story of the attempted overthrow of Castro's regime in Cuba, as told by the men who were there.

item.title: Afghanistan War: How can the West fight terrorism after leaving?
item.description: As Western troops prepare to go, there are concerns over the future of counter-terrorism operations.
